New Records: Phil Salt scored 87 not out, his highest score in T20Is
Key Match Events: England won by 8 wickets (with 15 balls remaining)
Phil Salt scored 87 not out, his highest score in T20Is
Jonny Bairstow scored 48* and contributed to a 97-run stand with Salt
Brandon King was injured and retired hurt in the 5th over
Rovman Powell hit 20 from the 15th over, including three sixes
Phil Salt hit 30 from the 16th over, including three sixes and three fours
England reached 58 for no loss after six overs, with Salt and Buttler at the crease
West Indies reached 180 for 4, with Rovman Powell and Sherfane Rutherford contributing to the total
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Jos Buttler won the toss and elected to bowl first
West Indies made two changes to their team, with Roston Chase and Romario Shepherd coming in
England also made two changes, with Mark Wood and Sam Curran coming in
The match was expected to be a run-fest, with the teams anticipating a high-scoring game
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler said he was pleased with the team's performance
West Indies captain Rovman Powell said his team had done well to reach 180
Phil Salt said he was happy to have contributed to the team's win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Daren Sammy National Stadium in St Lucia
The ground was named after West Indies head coach Daren Sammy
The match was the second in Group 2 of the Super Eights
England won the trophy in 2010 and 2022, while West Indies won it in 2012 and 2016
Others: The match was live-streamed on ESPN Cricinfo
The weather was hot and windy, with a brief shower on the west coast earlier in the day
